    • Constructor Detail

      • Connect

        public Connect(java.lang.String url,
       java.lang.String privateKey,
       java.lang.String serverCert,
       java.lang.String clientCert,
       int timeout,
       boolean debug)
        Constructor to set relevant parameters and add security provider
        Parameters:
        url - URL of the server where to connect
        privateKey - Private key of the user
        serverCert - Certificate of the server where to connect
        clientCert - Certificate to connect to the server and it should trust
        timeout - Time for connection timeout in milli seconds
        debug - If debug is set to true debug information will be print out. Otherwise it will not print debug information.

    • Method Detail

      • getConnection

        public java.net.URLConnection getConnection()
                                     throws java.security.KeyManagementException,
                                            java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                                            java.io.IOException
        Get a connection object. This will create key manager, trust manager, socket factory and set timeout.
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.security.KeyManagementException - If SSLContext can not be initialized
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - If no provider supports a TrustManagerFactorySpi implementation for the specified protocol
        java.io.IOException - If the string specifies an unknown protocol or if an I/O exception occurs

      • createConnectionObject

        private java.net.URLConnection createConnectionObject(java.lang.String urlString,
                                            javax.net.ssl.SSLSocketFactory sslSocketFactory)
                                               throws java.io.IOException
        Creates a connection object
        Parameters:
        urlString - String to parse as a URL.
        sslSocketFactory - The SSL socket factory
        Returns:
        A URLConnection to the URL. If it is a https connection return type will be a HttpsURLConnection
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the string specifies an unknown protocol or if an I/O exception occurs

      • initItAll

        private javax.net.ssl.SSLSocketFactory initItAll(javax.net.ssl.KeyManager[] keyManagers,
                                       javax.net.ssl.TrustManager[] trustManagers)
                                          throws java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                                                 java.security.KeyManagementException
        Inits SSLContext and create a SocketFactoryObject
        Parameters:
        keyManagers - Sources of authentication keys
        trustManagers - Sources of peer authentication trust decisions
        Returns:
        A SocketFactory object
        Throws:
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - If no provider supports a TrustManagerFactorySpi implementation for the specified protocol
        java.security.KeyManagementException - If SSLContext can not be initialized

      • createKeyManagers

        private javax.net.ssl.KeyManager[] createKeyManagers()
        Create KeyManagers to handle keys
        Returns:
        Array with KeyManager objects

      • createTrustManagers

        private javax.net.ssl.TrustManager[] createTrustManagers()
        Create TrustManagers to check validation of server certificates. Here TrustManagers will not check if a client is trusted
        Returns:
        Array with Trustmanager object
